intro: Pentacalia gibbiflora, commonly known as the swollen-flowered pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking, inflated, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are often clustered in racemes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
